question: Let the functions f and g be <katex>$f:[0,\frac{\pi}{2}]\rightarrow R$</katex> given by <katex>$f(x)=\sin x$</katex> and <katex>$g:[0,\frac{\pi}{2}]\rightarrow R$</katex> given by <katex>$g(x)=\cos x$</katex>. Consider the following statements:
Statement (I): f and g are one-one
Statement (II): <katex>$f+g$</katex> is one-one
Which of the following is correct?
choices: Statement (I) is true, statement (II) is false
Statement (I) is false, statement (II) is true
explanation: In <katex>$[0, \pi/2]$</katex>, <katex>$\sin x$</katex> is strictly increasing, so it is one-one. <katex>$\cos x$</katex> is strictly decreasing, so it is one-one. Statement I is true.
Since <katex>$h(0) = h(\pi/2)$</katex>, <katex>$f+g$</katex> is not one-one. Statement II is false.
